Legal_Issue: Whether a prothonotary has jurisdiction to hear and dispose of an application to strike a statement of claim under Rule 419(a)
Decision_Outcome: Application to strike the statement of claim was dismissed
Legal_Rule: Rule 336(1)(g) allows prothonotaries to handle interlocutory applications unless they must be heard by a judge
Procedural_Issue: Jurisdiction of prothonotary to hear motion to strike
Outcome_on_Merits: Plaintiff's claim was not struck; application dismissed
Applicant_Challenge: Defendants moved to strike the statement of claim
Court_Result: Motion to strike dismissed; costs awarded to plaintiff
Defendant_Response: Filed application to strike statement of claim
Remedy_Requested: Striking of the statement of claim
Outcome: Application dismissed, costs awarded to plaintiff
Remedy_Sought: Dismissal of copyright infringement claim via striking statement of claim
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Alleged insufficiency of the statement of claim in copyright infringement action
Applicable_Process: Interlocutory motion process before a prothonotary
Pending_Relief_or_Application: Application to strike statement of claim
